result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian Alvarado-Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge. To be collected by DOC out of up to 25%  prison wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one half (1/2) Initial Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.

No illegal drugs. No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screens.  No positive results. Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended supervision to be determined by DOC,  but to include those as listed.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.  
Defendant advised that he may neer again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian Alvarado-Rodriguez

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christian Alvarado-Rodriguez in court with attorney Heather L Johnson.  Defendant Christian Alvarado-Rodriguez in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statements by Ruth R. (Interpreter remains sworn and interprets for witness).  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 6 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 years with credit for 115 days 
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Absolute sobriety.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

  - Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, to be collected by the DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Christian Alvarado-Rodriguez in court with attorney Heather L Johnson.  Defendant Christian Alvarado-Rodriguez in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Sworn as interpreter:  Ismael Maldonado.
Parties ready to proceed to plea hearing.  Defendant sworn.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Firearm warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christian Alvarado-Rodriguez in court with attorney Heather L Johnson.  Defendant Christian Alvarado-Rodriguez in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholmew.  Court will allow one last adjournment.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christian Alvarado-Rodriguez in court with attorney Heather L Johnson.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hayes).  All conditions of bail remain the same.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christian Alvarado-Rodriguez in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Christian Alvarado-Rodriguez in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:Brenda Bartholomew.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL if defendant remains in custody.

Defendant Christian Alvarado-Rodriguez in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Christian Alvarado-Rodriguez in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sworn as interpreter:  Daniel Lopez  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
